content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Bras Basah Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(February 2021)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Bras Basah Single Member Constituency** was a [constituency](/wiki/Constituencies_of_Singapore) in Singapore. It existed from 1959 to 1976. It was represented in the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) by Hoe Puay Choo from 1959 to 1963 then by Ho See Beng from 1963 to 1976. ## History In 1976, the constituency was abolished and the electorate was divided between [Kampong Glam Constituency](/wiki/Kampong_Glam_Constituency) and [Telok Ayer Constituency](/wiki/Telok_Ayer_Constituency). ## Member of Parliament **Year** **Member****Party****Formation**(/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election)Hoe Puay Choo[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)(/wiki/1963_Singaporean_general_election)Ho See Beng(/wiki/1968_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1972_Singaporean_general_election)**Constituency abolished (1976)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s [General Election
